definition: a performance (or series of performances) at a public presentation, arrange a program of or for
details:
noun
- a performance (or series of performances) at a public presentation
= example: a performance (or series of performances) at a public presentation
= synonyms: programme
- a series of steps to be carried out or goals to be accomplished
= synonyms: programme, plan
- a system of projects or services intended to meet a public need
= example: a system of projects or services intended to meet a public need
= synonyms: programme
- a document stating the aims and principles of a political party
= synonyms: platform, political platform, political program
- (computer science) a sequence of instructions that a computer can interpret and execute
= example: (computer science) a sequence of instructions that a computer can interpret and execute
= synonyms: programme, computer program, computer programme
- a radio or television show
= example: a radio or television show
= synonyms: programme, broadcast
- an integrated course of academic studies
= example: an integrated course of academic studies
= synonyms: programme, course of study, curriculum, syllabus
- an announcement of the events that will occur as part of a theatrical or sporting event
= example: an announcement of the events that will occur as part of a theatrical or sporting event
= synonyms: programme
verb
- arrange a program of or for
= example: arrange a program of or for
= synonyms: programme
- write a computer program
= synonyms: programme
